tn.ref: I have made you like a god
tn.text: "I will cause Pharaoh to consider you as a god"

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:04:21|4:21]]. AT: "will cause Pharaoh to be stubborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The words "signs" and "wonders" mean basically the same thing. God uses them to emphasize the greatness of what he will do in Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: put my hand on ... reach out with my hand on
tn.text: The words "my hand" represent God's great power. AT: "use my power against ... show my powerful acts against" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
three years old** - "and Aaron was eighty-three years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: When Pharaoh says to you, 'Do a miracle,' then you will say to Aaron, 'Take your staff and throw it down before Pharaoh, so that it may become a snake.'
tn.text: This could be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "When Pharaoh tells you to do a miracle, then you will tell Aaron to take his staff and throw it down before Pharaoh, so that it may become a snake" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. AT: "Pharaoh became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:07:11|7:13]]. AT: "Pharaoh is stubborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: when he goes out to the water
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "when he goes down to the Nile River to bathe" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:07:11|7:13]]. AT: "Pharaoh became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The name of the river may be made explicit. AT: "in the Nile River" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "all" here is an exaggeration to emphasize how serious the problem was. AT: "Many of the Egyptians" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
